page.title: 01THE REAY AREA
page.content: The block is mainly rural with a height range of 117 metres, the highest point being Creag Leathan in the southern third of the block with a height of 127m.This area is open moorland because of its exposure to the elements due to its height. As the height of the land drops towards its lowest point of 10m on the coast this type of scenery gives way to stock rearing and cereal farming. The village of Reay is concentrated in the north-west of the square and hence this is where most of the amenities are found. An old-folk's home is situated in the centre of the block among one of the few patches of woodland found in the area.
